Column Comment.0: FACILITY ID: Number or code uniquely identifying the Facility.
Column Comment.1: FACILITY TYPE: The type of facility that is described in this row of data, such aspipeline, tank, battery etc. Please note that FACILITY_TYPE will eventually becomea SUBTYPE and downsized to 30 characters.
Column Comment.2: LICENSE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for this facility license.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: 13th MONTH ADJUSTMENT DESCRIPTION: A short textual description of the 13thmonth adjustment. Details about this should be managed in an accounting system.
Column Comment.5: 13th MONTH ADJUSTMENT INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the contractgoverning operations for the facility allows a 13th month adjustment.
Column Comment.6: APPLICATION ID: Unique identifier for applications you make for continuations,licenses etc. to the government.
Column Comment.7: FACILITY CLASSIFICATION TYPE: The type of classification assigned to the facility,such as sour gas. Often has a bearing on environmental restrictions andrequirements.
Column Comment.8: ASSIGNED FIELD IDENTIFIER: The unique identifier for field assigned to the facilityin the license document.
Column Comment.9: DESCRIPTION: Narrative descriptive remarks that accompany the license.
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.12: FACILITY LICENSE TYPE: The type of facility license or approval that is granted,such as processing, flaring, sales, venting etc. In some cases, all types may becombined into a single license and in others, multiple licenses may be granted.
Column Comment.13: FEES PAID INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether the fees reuqired for thislicense or authorization have been paid.
Column Comment.14: GRANTED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: the unique identifier for thebusiness associate, usually a regulatory agency, that grants this type of license.
Column Comment.15: GRANTED BY CONTACT ID: unique identifier for the person who is the contact forthe grantor of this license.
Column Comment.16: GRANTED DATE: The date that this license was granted.
Column Comment.17: GRANTED TO BA ID: the business associate that this license was granted to.
Column Comment.18: GRANTED TO CONTACT ID: unique identifier for the person who is the contact forthe grantee of this license.
Column Comment.19: FACILITY LICENSE EXTENSION CONDITION: The criteria that must be addressedin order for the primary term of the license to be extended. For example, constructionmust be started etc.
Column Comment.20: LICENSE LATITUDE: The latitude coordinate referenced in the license document.
Column Comment.21: LICENSE LOCATION: The location, generally in local referenced system, assignedto this facility in the license document.
Column Comment.22: LICENSE LONGITUDE: the longitude location referenced on the license document.
Column Comment.23: LICENSE NUMBER: The number assigned to this license by the granting agency,usually a regulatory authority.
Column Comment.24: LICENSE TERM: the term over which this license is granted, such as one year, 5years etc.
Column Comment.25: LICENSE TERM UNIT OF MEASURE: the unit of measure for the term of thelicense, such as year or month.
Column Comment.26: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.27: RATE and FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided.
Column Comment.28: RELATED FACILITY LICENSE ID: use this column to identify another facility whoselicense is associated with this one.
Column Comment.29: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.30: RENEWAL CONDITION: The condition that must be met for the license to berenewed at the end of term.
Column Comment.31: SECONDARY TERM: the secondary or extended term granted for this license.
Column Comment.33: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.34: VIOLATION INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this license has been in violationof at least one requirement. Details are captured in the FACILLITY LICENSE FAILtable.
Column Comment.35: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.36: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.37: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.38: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.39: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.40: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.41: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
